intro: Pimelea barbata subsp. omoia, commonly known as the slender everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Western Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its narrow, upright stems and small, fluffy white or pale yellow flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. The leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and the plant is adapted to dry, sandy soils. It is part of the family Thymelaeaceae and is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions. This subspecies is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and resilience.
